head.title: Jeb Bush's Role In the Everglades

hedline.hl1: Jeb Bush's Role In the Everglades

abstract.p: Florida Gov Jeb Bush letter disagrees with July 13 editorial that suggested his efforts to help preserve the Florida Everglades have been less than vigorous (M)

block.p: ''An Everglades Action Plan'' (editorial, July 13) suggested that my efforts to help preserve the Everglades have been less than vigorous.

On Jan. 18, I traveled to Everglades National Park to unveil an unprecedented plan to finance the state's portion of the restoration of America's Everglades: a $2 billion commitment over the next 10 years. This spring, I successfully lobbied the Florida Legislature to approve this financial commitment. In early May, I testified before a Congressional committee in Washington seeking a dollar-for-dollar federal commitment to restore the Everglades.
''An Everglades Action Plan'' (editorial, July 13) suggested that my efforts to help preserve the Everglades have been less than vigorous.

On Jan. 18, I traveled to Everglades National Park to unveil an unprecedented plan to finance the state's portion of the restoration of America's Everglades: a $2 billion commitment over the next 10 years. This spring, I successfully lobbied the Florida Legislature to approve this financial commitment. In early May, I testified before a Congressional committee in Washington seeking a dollar-for-dollar federal commitment to restore the Everglades.

On May 16, I was joined by an uncommonly unified group of Everglades stakeholders to sign Florida's Everglades Restoration Investment Act into law. From the beginning of my administration, my commitment to Everglades restoration has been consistently fervent.
JEB BUSH Governor Tallahassee, Fla., July 13, 2000
